programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Contractual Obligation Implementation: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard are forced to volunteer for a university committee. Raj plans a stress-free date with Lucy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Closet Reconfiguration: When Howard and Bernadette get Sheldon to organise their untidy closet, Sheldon finds an unopened letter from Howard's long-absent father.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tenure Turbulence: Leonard, Sheldon, Raj and Kripke all compete for the same vacancy at the university.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spanish Pavillion: Gordon Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion, a family-run restaurant whose owners, brothers Michael and Jerry, spend more time struggling for power than working.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Darren's world turns upside down, while Diane faces her true feelings. Peri finds comfort in Tom. Sienna decides to do whatever it takes to escape. And Tony's case suffers a shocking blow.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri finds comfort in Tom as sparks fly during their date. Sienna decides to do whatever it takes to escape. And a shocking theory about Robbie's whereabouts leaves residents heartbroken.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony's case suffers a shocking blow. Clare celebrates when Donny delivers some news. And two residents find comfort in one another.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spanish Pavillion: Gordon Ramsay visits Spanish Pavillion, a family-run restaurant whose owners, brothers Michael and Jerry, spend more time struggling for power than working.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: One more couple say 'I do', but will the groom's humour leave his wife unamused? And as the final honeymoons continue, is there trouble in paradise for one pair?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In the Name of the Grandfather: Homer takes the family to Ireland so that Grampa can visit quaint village pub O'Flanagan's one last time.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Wedding for Disaster: Homer and Marge discover that they're not officially married when Reverend Lovejoy finds out he wasn't a licensed minister at the time of their ceremony.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Santa Simulation: Sheldon unwillingly reveals painful memories of Christmas past when Leonard persuades him to join in with a seasonal game of Dungeons & Dragons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Egg Salad Equivalency: Sheldon is accused of sexual harassment and sent to Human Resources, where he ends up dragging Leonard, Raj and Howard into trouble too.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Chirp: Claire and Haley have a bit of quality girl time while they're stuck at home sick. Phil is preoccupied by the taunts of a chirping smoke detector.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny Get Your Gun: Everyone gathers at a restaurant to celebrate Manny's birthday, although Manny himself is experiencing a mini-life crisis about getting older.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotive Manipulation: Love is in the air when Amy convinces Sheldon to join her for a romantic train trip to Napa Valley to celebrate Valentine's Day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Table Polarization: Leonard buys a dining table for the flat but Sheldon objects to such a big change inside his home. Meanwhile, Howard gets the chance to return to space.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Friendship Turbulence: In an attempt to improve their strained friendship, Howard invites Sheldon to visit NASA with him. Penny is upset when her car breaks down.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Mommy Observation: Sheldon pays a surprise visit to his mother in Houston and is forced to confront a new reality. Raj throws a murder mystery-themed dinner party.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Big House (Part 1/2): Adjusting to life behind bars, Peralta bonds with a cellmate and is forced to join a prison gang, while Diaz puts her visitors to the test.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Big House (Part 2/2): Peralta is trapped by divided loyalties after the warden persuades him to investigate prison gang leader Romero's drug smuggling operation.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Holidays of Future Passed: The Simpsons flash forward three decades to a high-tech, futuristic Springfield, where Bart and Lisa each have children of their own.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson: Homer gets his own political talk show after a video of his impassioned rant about how he was treated at the airport goes viral.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: One more couple say 'I do', but will the groom's humour leave his wife unamused? And as the final honeymoons continue, is there trouble in paradise for one pair?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Clean Room Infiltration: Amy hosts a Victorian Christmas Eve dinner, complete with party games. Raj, Leonard and Howard have pigeon problems.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Space Probe Disintegration: Howard tries to calm a stressed Raj, who is anxiously awaiting the arrival of some data from a space probe that he helped launch.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Helter Skelter: The Simpsons' house must be fumigated after a hockey player gives Lisa his termite-infested stick. The only place they can find to live is in a reality TV show.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Great Louse Detective: When someone tries to murder Homer, Chief Wiggum seeks help from someone who understands the mind of a killer: Sideshow Bob.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Haunted by questions, John Paul digs into what really happened on the night when Bobby died. Clare won't stop until she gets her money back, and secrets continue to tear a family apart.

programme.title: Hollyoaks at 30: Most Explosive...
programme.desc: ...Episodes: A look back at a classic episode ahead of Hollyoaks' 30thanniversary. A devastating accident threatens to destroy lives in the village, while Doug can't let go of the past.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: This time the First Daters looking for love include a singing pharmacist, a straight-talker, and a former Olympic trampolinist who's worried about his place on the 'ginger scale'.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: Our couples move in together and adjust to married life. Sparks fly at the dinner party, when two brides give less-than-glowing reviews of their hubbies... awks!

programme.title: New: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Brand new series: A devastated Jack confronts Livvy and Kit. Tabitha sets her sights on Arman. Jazz confides in Jules. And will Beks and Olly's holiday fling fizzle out in London?

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: (2015) Sin City thriller with Jason Statham. A compulsive gambler who does favours for money just wants out of the Vegas life. Just one big win at the tables should do it...

programme.title: The Long Good Friday
programme.desc: (1980) Bob Hoskins and Helen Mirren star in John MacKenzie's East London gangster thriller. Gang leader Hoskins' hold over his empire is under threat.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: (2020) Cheeky comedy with Megan Fox. A young science prodigy (Gabriel Bateman) invents a piece of tech that lets him and his pet dog communicate with each other telepathically.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy starring Faye Dunaway and Rupert Everett. A hotel owner's attempt to upgrade her star rating is undermined by the arrival of a master thief and his light-fingered orangutan.

programme.title: Time Bandits
programme.desc: (1981) Fantasy comedy. David Rappaport stars as the leader of rebel dwarves who kidnap a boy, Craig Warnock, and take him on adventures across time. With Sean Connery and John Cleese.

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: Plane
programme.desc: (2023) Action thriller starring Gerard Butler as an airline pilot who must become a one-man army after crashlanding on an island overrun by bad guys. To survive, he's gonna have to wing it.

programme.title: The Predator
programme.desc: (2018) Unrestrained reboot of the franchise defined by a ruthless extraterrestrial killer whose name says it all... and it's had a DNA upgrade. All the better to kill you with, my dear.

programme.title: Unsane
programme.desc: (2018) Claire Foy stars in Steven Soderbergh's creepy thriller about a woman who is being stalked by the son of a man she cared for in his dying days. But is it all in her head?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: (2022) Family comedy with Michael Pea. A young lad discovers that his slacker dad is a superhero. And before he's got used to the idea, he must foil a villain's plot to bring his dad down.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: (1994) Festive family drama. Richard Attenborough stars as a department store Santa who insists he's the real Santa Claus. But can he prove it in court?

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: (2019) Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: (2018) Nautical action thriller. Gerard Butler stars as an unconventional submarine skipper sent to investigate the torpedoing of a US vessel. With Gary Oldman, Linda Cardellini and Common.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me
programme.desc: (2018) Action comedy starring Mila Kunis and Kate McKinnon. Two friends become embroiled in espionage after one of them gets dumped by a man she didn't even know was a spy. Surprise!

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: (2013) Drama starring Tom Hardy. A construction manager's life dramatically begins to fall apart as he drives home from work. With the voices of Ruth Wilson, Olivia Colman and Andrew Scott.

programme.title: LumoTV: Sign2Win
programme.desc: In this family episode, the teams consist of a child and an adult competing for 1,000. Will we see a family feud as these teams face five challenging games?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: The Man from Colorado
programme.desc: (1948) Western. When a sadistic Union colonel (Glenn Ford) becomes a federal judge after the Civil War, his friend (William Holden) takes the deputy job to try and temper his actions.

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: (1952) War drama. Trevor Howard plays the captain of an ageing US warship, gifted to the British navy, which is chosen to lead the raid on Saint-Nazaire in 1942. With Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: (1985) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. To free his kidnapped daughter, an ex US commando must agree to assassinate a South American president. But he's not as pliant as he seems...

programme.title: Dead Man's Shoes
programme.desc: (2004) Shane Meadows' thriller starring Paddy Considine, Gary Stretch and Toby Kebbell. An ex-soldier is bent on revenge against the drug dealers who cruelly tormented his younger brother.

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: (2011) Thriller with Jason Statham and Donald Sutherland. A hitman is ordered to kill his mentor, but then takes on the dead man's son as an apprentice. Could get complicated... and deadly.

programme.desc: We Have Put Her Living in the Tomb: A classic episode of solid gold comedy. Amid their decorating, Victor and Margaret are entrusted with the care of Kylie the tortoise for a week.

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story

programme.desc: Departures: Fred Dibnah and his wife Alison solve the problem of where to go on holiday by visiting separate locations - she flies off to Greece, while he attends a steam rally. Ep3

programme.desc: Ships and Engineering: Fred Dibnah recalls the golden age of shipbuilding, examining the skills of engineers who made Britain one of the leading manufacturing nations.

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam

programme.desc: Austin Healey: Up for auction this week is a 1980 Ford Escort, a hand-built 1946 Bedford 12 electric car, and a beautiful, red 1957 Austin Healey.
